valid_articles.Title: Majestic to discontinue its disavow links feature
valid_articles.Description: Majestic will discontinue its disavow links feature. The company never encouraged customers to use the feature and does not believe it is an effective way to identify toxic links.

valid_articles.Title: Amazon's AI shopping assistant Rufus is live
valid_articles.Description: Amazon's AI shopping assistant, Rufus, is now available to all US customers in the Amazon mobile app. Rufus was first announced in February and has been trained on Amazon's product catalog.

valid_articles.Title: SEO Video recap: Google volatility x2, another Google indexing bug, Google Ads defaulting to broad match and YouTube SEO tips
valid_articles.Description: This week, guess what, we had more volatility over the weekend and also a blip in the middle of the week.  Google also had another indexing bug that lasted only about an hour.  Google Search Console had a bug with new owner notifications. Google Search Console now lets you enter your shipping and return policies in settings. Google said it found the feedback it collected on the last core update really helpful.  Google updated its URL best practices document to say don’t use fragments to change content on the page.  Google Search will now extract composite images with trained algorithmic media types...

valid_articles.Description: Google is making more use of the right sidebar on desktop search results and overlays on mobile search results. This is similar to the experience when clicking on a merchant listing.

valid_articles.Title: Ugly Ads Perform Best, Marketer Says
valid_articles.Description: Barry Hott recommends ugly ads, those that people won't skip over. First reactions to an ad largely determine its performance, he states.

valid_articles.Title: AI overviews in search results have not dropped to 7%
valid_articles.Description: Glenn Gabe reports that AI overviews in search results have not dropped to 7%, as previously reported by BrightEdge. Gabe's own tracking shows that AI overviews still make up around 14% of search results.

valid_articles.Title: OpenAI search coming?

valid_articles.Title: OpenAI is working on a search product

valid_articles.Title: Bing Search Testing Voting Feature
valid_articles.Description: Bing is testing a voting feature in the Bing Search results. You can vote up or vote down specific search results in the search results page.  It even shows you the percentage of votes for those who voted it up versus voted it down.

valid_articles.Title: The era of the in-depth brand and gaming creator partnership has arrived
valid_articles.Description: To reach gamers outside of video games, brands have moved beyond one-off activations based on specific intellectual properties toward more fully integrated programs that span across all aspects of a creator’s community and fandom.

valid_articles.Title: Why longer videos are becoming more commonplace on YouTube
valid_articles.Description: Short-form videos may have surged in popularity over the past several years, but the long-form video format is on the comeback trail.

valid_articles.Description: AI tools and platforms, whether they're built on generative AI or glorified machine learning, have flooded the marketplace. In response, agencies are wading through them via sandboxes, internal AI task forces and client contracts.

valid_articles.Title: Media Buying Briefing: Retail media has become a full-funnel play for media agencies
valid_articles.Description: Holding companies as well as independents have stepped up their resource-building around retail media and the broader catch-all of commerce media — although there’s a lack of standardization around the terminology used in the space.

valid_articles.Description: RT by @aleyda: 🧵 I can't believe I am about to write this but... the Bing index is crucial in the future of SEO. Why? It's not about Bing the search engine. Bing's index now also powers ChatGPT (and thus, soon Apple's Siri), Meta AI, LinkedIn AI and Microsoft Copilot.

valid_articles.Title: Google Says Having Massive Disavow Lists & Removing Them Should Not Worry You
valid_articles.Description: John Mueller from Google was asked if you should worry that massive link disavow lists can hurt you negatively and also if you remove the list that it might also hurt you.  John said you should not be worried at all, when he was asked how worried should you be, he said "zero."
